laboratory_examinations.findings: Extremely low serum concentrations of IGF-I (15 ng/ml, normal range 242–660 ng/ml), which remained abnormally low after 4 days of GH treatment.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Endocrine analysis of spontaneous overnight GH secretion
laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal to high concentrations of GH, with integrated levels of 14.2 ng/ml.
Negative aggregation tests with ADP, ristocetin, collagen, and epinephrine.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At 15 yr of age, repeated test indicated no aggregation with ADP, collagen, or epinephrine and weak aggregation with ristocetin.

laboratory_examinations.findings: GHBP level was normal (1232 pmol/liter; normal range, 431-1892 pmol/liter).

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Circulating IGF-I, IGF-binding protein-3, and acid-labile subunit levels
laboratory_examinations.findings: IGF-I (7 ng/ml; normal, 242–660 ng/ml), IGFBP-3 (543 ng/ml; normal, 2500–4800 ng/ml), ALS (1.2 g/ml; normal, 5.6–16 g/ml) were markedly low.
No intact or truncated STAT5b protein detected in cell lysates from patient; normal expression in control samples.
